text:
The Windows NT/2K Service installation points to the jre\bin\hotspot\jvm.dll
On JDK 1.4 beta 2 the only jvm directories present are client and server
so the service does not start without manual intervention
creator: dylans@xs4all.nl

text:
The VM "detection" uses whatever is indicated in the Windows registry. I'll try
with 1.4 to see what is in the registry.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
Fixed. TC 4.0 RC1 will have the fix, and should now install fine on JRE/JDK 1.4.

The jvm.dll has moved in 1.4. The location of the VM is pointed by 
the "RuntimeLib", so that what is used now, instead of using "JavaHome" and 
appending \bin\hotspot\jvm.dll.
As a side effect, TC 4 will now be run with the JRE.
creator: remm@apache.org
